page.title: 01Sea to North of Ob Lusa Skye
page.content: Forestry - extensive coniferous monoculture of Sitka Spruce with European larch at boundaries. Main A850 Broadford/Kyleakin road runs through this area and has been recently modernised (1981-82). The rough grazing to the north of the road and bordering the shoreline are utilised by a flock of mainly Scottish Blackface sheep (being improved, with a weaving percentage of 85-90), and a herd of spring calving suckler cows, Aberdeen Angus and Hereford cross. The shore is used by people to supplement their income by gathering whelks (Cittorina Littorea) mainly in the winter. The large sea area is not rich in Pelagic or Demersal fish stocks but there is a thriving commercial shell-fish fishery included in this section. There are no human habitations in this area.
